A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data
draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-05 draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-06
Abstract Abstract
Network platforms use Model-driven Telemetry, and in particular YANG- Network platforms use Model-driven Telemetry, such as YANG-Push, to
Push, to continuously stream information, including both counters and continuously stream information, including both counters and state
state information. This document documents the metadata that ensure information. This document describes the metadata that ensure that
that the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document
specifies the Data Manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the specifies the data manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the
Platform Manifest and the Data Collection Manifest). These YANG platform manifest and the data collection manifest). These YANG
modules are specified at the network (i.e. controller) level to modules are specified at the network (e.g. controller) level to
provide a model that encompasses several network platforms. The Data provide a model that encompasses several network platforms. The data
Manifest must be streamed and stored along with the data, up to the manifest must be streamed and stored along with the data, up to the
collection and analytics system in order to keep the collected data collection and analytics systems in order to keep the collected data
fully exploitable by the data scientists. fully exploitable by the data scientists and relevant tools.
Additionally, this document proposes an augmentation of the YANG-Push
model to include the actual collection period, in case it differs
from the configured collection period.

1.1. Use Cases 2. Terminology
1.1.1. Network Analytics The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT",
"SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and
"OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP
14 [RFC2119] [RFC8174] when, and only when, they appear in all
capitals, as shown here.
Platform: equipment of the network able to produce telemetry.
Data manifest: The necessary data required to interpret a telemetry
information.
Platform manifest: part of the data manifest that completely
characterizes the platform producing the telemetry information
Data collection manifest: part of the data manifest that completely
characterizes how and when the telemetry information was metered.
Datapoint: an instance of data collected via telemetry at a specific
time.
Collector: software that receives the stream of telemetry.
3. Use Cases

analytics, incident detections, and in the end closed-loop analytics, incident detection, and in the closed control loop for
automation. This streamed data can be stored in a database network automation. See [I-D.ietf-nmop-terminology] for definition
(sometimes called a big data lake) for further analysis. of some of these terms. This streamed data can be stored in a
database (sometimes called a big data lake) for further analysis.

evolution of a specific counter collected from a network platform. evolution of a specific counter collected from a network platform.

1.1.2. New Device Onboarding 3.2. New Device Onboarding
When a new device is onboarded, operators must make sure that the new When a new device is onboarded, operators have to check that the new
device streams data with YANG-Push, that the telemetry data is the device streams data with YANG-Push, that the telemetry data is the
right ones, that the data is correctly ingested in the collection right ones, that the data is correctly ingested in the collection
system, and finally that the data can be analyzed (compared with system, and finally that the data can be analyzed (compared with

must be linked to the data up to the collection and analytics system, must be linked to the data up to the collection and analytics system,
contains all the relevant information. contains the relevant information.
1.1.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking 3.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking
The concept behind the data mesh https://www.datamesh- The concept behind the data mesh [DataMesh] are:
architecture.com/ are:
* Principle of Domain Ownership: Architecturally and * Domain Ownership: Architecturally and organizationally align
organizationally align business, technology, and analytical data, business, technology, and analytical data, following the line of
following the line of responsibility. Here, the Data Mesh responsibility. The Data Mesh principles adopt the boundary of
principles adopt the boundary of bounded context to individual bounded context to individual data products where each domain is
data products where each domain is responsible for (and owns) its responsible for (and owns) its data and models.
data and models.
* Principle of Data as a Product: The Domain owners are * Data as a Product: The Domain owners are responsible to provide
responsible to provide the data in useful way (discoverable the data in useful way (discoverable through a catalog,
through a catalog, addressable with a permanent and unique addressable with a permanent and unique address, understandable
address, understandable with well defined semantics, trustworthy with well-defined semantics, trustworthy and truthful, self-
and truthful, self-describing for easy consumption, interoperable describing for easy consumption, interoperable by supporting
by supporting standards, secure, self-contained, etc.) and should standards, secure, self-contained, etc.) and should treat
treat consumers of that data as customers. It requires and relies consumers of that data as customers. It requires and relies on
on the Domain Ownership principle. the Domain Ownership principle.
* Principle of Self-serve Data Platform: This fosters the sharing of * Self-serve Data Platform: This fosters the sharing of cross-domain
cross-domain data in order to create extra value. data in order to create extra value.
* Principle of Federated Computational Governance: Describes the * Federated Computational Governance: Describes the operating model
operating model and approach to establishing global policies and approach to establishing global policies across a mesh of data
across a mesh of data products. products.

3. Platform Manifest Figure 1: YANG tree diagram for "ietf-yp-current-period" module
3.1. Overview of the Model The code of the "ietf-yp-current" YANG module is given below.
Figure 1 contains the YANG tree diagram [RFC8340] of the ietf- <CODE BEGINS> file "ietf-yp-current-period@2025-02-21.yang"
module ietf-yp-current-period {
yang-version 1.1;
namespace "urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:yang:ietf-yp-current-period";
prefix yp-cp;
import ietf-subscribed-notifications {
prefix sn;
reference
"RFC 8639: A YANG Data Model for Subscriptions to
Event Notifications";
}
import ietf-yang-push {
prefix yp;
reference
"RFC 8641: Subscriptions to YANG Datastores.";
}
organization
"IETF OPSAWG (Operations and Management Area) Working Group";
contact
"WG Web: <https://datatracker.ietf.org/wg/opsawg/>
WG List: <mailto:opsawg@ietf.org>
Author: Benoit Claise <mailto:benoit.claise@huawei.com>
Author: Jean Quilbeuf <mailto:jean.quilbeuf@huawei.com>
Author: Diego R. Lopez <diego.r.lopez@telefonica.com>
Author: Ignacio Dominguez
<ignacio.dominguezmartinez@telefonica.com>
Author: Thomas Graf <thomas.graf@swisscom.com>";
description
"This module augments ietf-subscribed-notification and
ietf-yang-push with the current-period statistics reporting the
actual collection period, as opposed to the configured one.
Copyright (c) 2025 IETF Trust and the persons identified as
authors of the code. All rights reserved.
Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or
without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject
to the license terms contained in, the Revised BSD License
set forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions
Relating to IETF Documents
(https://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).
This version of this YANG module is part of RFC XXXX; see the
RFC itself for full legal notices. ";
revision 2025-02-21 {
description
"Initial revision";
reference
"RFC xxxx: A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data";
}
augment "/sn:subscriptions/sn:subscription" {
description
"Adds current period statistics";
leaf current-period {
when '../yp:periodic';
type yp:centiseconds;
description
"Period during two successive data collections, in the
current state. Might differ from the configured period
when the platform might increase the period
automatically when it is overloaded.";
}
}
}

5. Platform Manifest
5.1. Overview of the Model
Figure 2 contains the YANG tree diagram [RFC8340] of the ietf-
platform-manifest module. The tree diagram is obtained by reusing platform-manifest module. The tree diagram is obtained by reusing
existing modules, such as ietf-yang-library [RFC8525] using the YANG existing modules, such as "ietf-yang-library" [RFC8525] using the
mount mechanism [RFC8528]. Additionally to the YANG module in YANG mount mechanism [RFC8528]. In addition to the YANG module in
Section 3.2, we specify the YANG-library instance to be mounted. We Section 5.2, this document specifies the YANG-library instance to be
explain in Appendix C how the YANG tree is obtained. mounted. Appendix C explains how the YANG tree is obtained.
module: ietf-platform-manifest module: ietf-platform-manifest
+--ro platforms +--ro platforms
+--mp platform* [id] +--mp platform* [id]
+--ro id string +--ro id string
+--ro name? string +--ro name? string
+--ro vendor? string +--ro vendor? string
+--ro vendor-pen? uint32 +--ro vendor-pen? uint32
+--ro software-version? string +--ro software-version? string
+--ro software-flavor? string +--ro software-flavor? string
+--ro os-version? string +--ro os-version? string
+--ro os-type? string +--ro os-type? string
+--ro yang-library/ +--ro yang-library/
| +--ro module-set* [name] | +--ro module-set* [name]
| | +--ro name string | | +--ro name string
| | +--ro module* [name] | | +--ro module* [name]
| | | +--ro name yang:yang-identifier | | | +--ro name yang:yang-identifier

The 'data-collections' container contains the information related to The 'data-collections' container contains the information related to
each YANG-Push subscription. As for the Platform Manifest, these each YANG-Push subscription. As for the platform manifest, these
subscriptions are indexed by the platform id, so that all subscriptions are indexed by the 'platform-id', so that all
subscriptions in the network can be represented in the module. subscriptions in the network can be represented at the network level
without any conflict.
As most of the information related to YANG-push subscription As most of the information related to YANG-push subscription
[RFC8639] and [RFC8641] is stored in the ietf-yang-push model, we [RFC8639] and [RFC8641] is stored in the "ietf-yang-push" module,
mount these modules. These modules have a part common to all these modules are mounted. These modules have a part common to all
subscriptions of the platform, stored in the 'streams' and 'filters' subscriptions of the platform, stored in the 'streams' and 'filters'
container. The information about subscriptions themselves are stored containers. The information about subscriptions themselves are
in the 'subscriptions/subscription' list, indexed by subscription id. stored in the 'subscriptions/subscription' list, indexed by a
subscription identifier.
In the subscription object, the 'current-period' indicates the period In the subscription object, the 'current-period' indicates the period
currently used between two updates. That leaf can only be present currently used between two updates. That leaf can only be present
when the subscription is periodic. The current period might differ when the subscription is periodic. The current period might differ
from the requested period if the platform implements a mechanism to from the requested period if the platform implements a mechanism to
increase the collection period when it is overloaded. Having the increase the collection period when it is overloaded. Having the
current period information is crucial to understand if telemetry is current period information is crucial to understand if telemetry is
missing because of a bug or a packet loss or simply because it was missing because of a bug or a packet loss or simply because it was
dynamically adjusted by the platform. dynamically adjusted by the platform.

manifest-statistics' presented in Section 4.2. This module augments collection-manifest-statistics' presented in Section 4. This module
the subscription list from the module 'ietf-subscribed- augments the subscription list from the module 'ietf-subscribed-

5. Data Manifest and the Collected Data 7. Data Manifest and the Collected Data
5.1. Collecting the Data Manifest
The Data Manifest MUST be streamed and stored along with the This section focuses on relating the collected data to the data
manifest. As this document specifically focuses on giving context on
data collected via streamed telemetry, it is assumed that a streaming
telemetry system is available. Another premise of this document is
the storage of the collected data into a database for later
exploitation. It is assumed that such a database exists and can be
used for storing the data manifest.
7.1. Collecting the Data Manifest
The data manifest MUST be streamed and stored along with the
collected data. In case the collected data are moved to a different collected data. In case the collected data are moved to a different
place (typically a database), the Data Manifest MUST follow the place (typically a database), the companion data manifest MUST follow
collected data. This can render the collected data unusable if that the collected data. Storing the collected data without the companion
context is lost, for instance when the data is stored without the data manifest might prevent the correct interpretation of the
relevant information. The Data Manifest MUST be updated when the collected data. The data manifest MUST be updated when the data
Data Manifest information changes, for example, when a router is manifest information changes, for example, when a router is upgraded,
upgraded, when a new telemetry subscription is configured, or when when a new telemetry subscription is configured, or when the
the telemetry subscription parameters change. The Data Manifest can telemetry subscription parameters change. The data manifest can
itself be considered as a time series, and stored in a similar itself be considered as a time series, and stored in a similar
fashion to the collected data. fashion to the collected data.
The collected data should be mapped to the Data Manifest. Since the This document recommends reusing the existing telemetry system (in-
Data Manifest will not change as frequently as the collected data band approach) in order to lower the efforts for implementing this
itself, it makes sense to map several data to the same Data Manifest. approach. To enable a platform supporting streaming telemetry to

With YANG-push, each notification sent by the device is part of a As explained in the introduction, three elements are necessary to

We dont focus on the timing aspect as storing both the data and * The subscription identifier, platform identifier and time stamp of
their manifest in a time series database (TSDB) will allow the data the data are retrieved from the datapoint metadata
scientists to look for the Data Manifest corresponding to the

collected datapoint, the query to the TSDB would be to get the last
version of the Data Manifest before that timestamp. In that
scenario, the reliability of the collection of the Data Manifest is
the same as the reliability of the data collection itself, since the
Data Manifest is like any other data.
5.3. Operational Considerations * The platform manifest for that datapoint is obtained by looking up
the latest version before the time stamp matching the platform
identifier.
It is expected that the Data Manifest is streamed directly from the * The data collection manifest for that datapoint is obtained by
network equipment, along with YANG-Push [RFC8641] data. However, if looking up the latest version before the time matching the
the network equipment streaming telemetry does not support yet the platform identifier and the subscription identifier.
YANG modules from the Data Manifest specified in this document, the
telemetry collector could populate the Data Manifest from available
information collected from the platform. However, this option
requires efforts on the telemetry collector side, as the information
gathered in the Data Manifest proposed in this document could be
scattered among various standard and vendor- specific YANG modules
[RFC8199], that depend on the platform.
That Data Manifest should be kept and available even if the source The reliability of the collection of the data manifest is the same as
platform is not accessible (from the collection system), or if the the reliability of the data collection itself, since the data
platform has been updated (new operating system or new manifest is like any other data.
configuration). The Platform Manifest is "pretty" stable and should
change only when the platform is updated or patched. On the other
hand, the Data Collection Manifest is likely to change each time a
new YANG-Push subscription [RFC8641] is requested and might even
change if the platform load increases and collection periods are
updated. To separate these two parts, we enclose each of them in its
own module.

information collected from the platform. This latter option requires
efforts on the telemetry collector side, as the information gathered
in the data manifest proposed in this document could be scattered
among various standard and vendor-specific YANG modules [RFC8199],
that depend on the platform.

7. Security Considerations 9. Security Considerations
As we are reusing an existing telemetry system, the security As the present approach reuses an existing telemetry system, the
considerations lies with the new content divulged in the new security considerations lie with the new content divulged in the new
manifests. Appropriate access control must be associated to the manifests. Appropriate access control filters must be associated to
corresponding leafs and containers. the corresponding leafs and containers.

Appendix C. Generating YANG Tree Diagrams Appendix C. Generating YANG Tree Diagrams
This section provides the files needed to generate the YANG tree This section provides the files needed to generate the YANG tree
diagrams [RFC8340] from Figure 1 and Figure 2. The diagrams were diagrams [RFC8340] from Figure 2 and Figure 3. The diagrams were
obtained using yanglint https://github.com/CESNET/libyang version obtained using yanglint [yanglint] version 2.1.80, using the YANG
2.1.80, using the YANG Schema Mount [RFC8528]. They were manually Schema Mount [RFC8528]. They were manually edited to remove parts
edited to remove parts irrelevant to this document such as data nodes irrelevant to this document such as data nodes from imported modules,
from imported modules, notifications and RPCs. notifications and RPCs.
In order to get a tree diagram involving YANG Schema Mount with In order to get a tree diagram involving YANG Schema Mount with
yanglint, two data files are required, in addition to the YANG yanglint, two data files are required, in addition to the YANG
module, its dependencies and the YANG modules to be mounted. First module, its dependencies and the YANG modules to be mounted. The
we need the extension data, containing the YANG library to use at the first required file the extension data, containing the YANG library
mount point. Then we need the YANG library to use at the top-level to use at the mount point. The second required file is the YANG
context. We provide below the commands used to get the "raw" YANG library to use at the top-level context. The commands used to get
Tree diagrams from these files. the "raw" YANG Tree diagrams from these files are given in the next
sections.
C.1. YANG Tree Diagram of the Platform Manifest C.1. YANG Tree Diagram of the Platform Manifest
For the Platform Manifest, the extension data is provided in For the platform manifest, the extension data is provided in
Section 3.2 as "platform-extension-data.xml". The top-level YANG Section 5.2 as "platform-extension-data.xml". The top-level YANG
library is included below as "platform-toplevel-yanglib.xml". The library is included below as "platform-toplevel-yanglib.xml". The
following command was used to obtain the YANG Tree diagram (before following command was used to obtain the YANG Tree diagram (before
manual edition). manual edition).
